Event.name: Cause_fluidic_motion
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Agent</fen> or a <fen>Cause</fen> causes a <fen>Fluid</fen> to move from a <fen>Source</fen> to a <fen>Goal</fen> along a <fen>Path</fen> or within an <fen>Area</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Agent">I</fex> <t>splattered</t> <fex name="Fluid">red paint</fex> <fex name="Area">nearby</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Agent
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The animate protagonist who causes the <fen>Fluid</fen> to move.
<ex>What happens if <fex name="Agent">we</fex> <t>drip</t> acid on this compound?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Cause
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An event or force that causes the <fen>Fluid</fen> to move.
<ex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Fluid
Arg.definition: <def-root>The entity that changes location and moves in a fluidic way. It is not necessarily in a liquid state but is construed that way.</def-root>

Arg.name: Goal
Arg.definition:
<def-root><fen>Goal</fen> is the location the <fen>Fluid</fen> ends up in as a result of the motion
<ex>Why did you <t>squirt</t> juice <fex name="Goal">onto my chair</fex>?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition: <def-root>The trajectory along which the Fluid moves, exclusive of the <fen>Source</fen> and <fen>Goal</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Area
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The setting in which the <fen>Fluid</fen>'s movement takes place along an unspecified <fen>Path</fen>.
<ex> I <t>splattered</t> red paint <fex name="Area"> nearby</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root> Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). With agentive uses, it may indicate salient characteristics of an Agent that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully).
<ex></ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Time</fen> when the fluidic motion event is caused.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition: <def-root>A state of affairs that the <fen>Agent</fen> is responding to in causing the <fen>Fluid</fen> to move.</def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>A state of the <fen>Fluid</fen> that results from the motion event.</def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The location where the motion takes place.
<ex>I <t>spattered</t> the egg all over the floor <fex name="pla">in the kitchen</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Instrument
Arg.definition: <def-root>The entity manipulated by the <fen>Agent</fen> which causes the <fen>Fluid</fen> to move.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An action of the <fen>Agent</fen> which brings about the motion of the <fen>Fluid</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition: <def-root>The state-of-affairs that the <fen>Agent</fen> is attempting to bring about by causing motion. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: splatter.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: splash (a sticky or viscous liquid) in a messy fashion.

lexUnit.name: splash.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: make (liquid) strike or fall on something in drops

lexUnit.name: squirt.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: (with reference to a liquid) be or cause to be ejected in a thin jet from a small opening.

lexUnit.name: pump.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: force (liquid, gas, etc.) to move by or as if by means of a pump.

lexUnit.name: sprinkle.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: shoot or drip in drops

lexUnit.name: dribble.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to pour slowly resulting in drops or an unsteady stream

lexUnit.name: spew.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to let out in large quantities

lexUnit.name: spill.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to pour something out of or over the edge of a container onto a non-canonical location
